tweets.html:
I like to think of cable/satellite carriage disputes as stealth media literacy campaigns.

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) July 13, 2012

Articles suggesting the DirecTV-Viacom spat is the last straw for the MSOs are oh-so cute. Even cuter than the last 29 times I've read them.

— Andrew Wallenstein (@awallenstein) July 13, 2012

Then again, "add Hodor" is the best recipe to improve every show, no? "One Upon A Hodor." "Hodorland." "Breaking Hodor." SEE?

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 13, 2012

"Starsky And Hodor." "Raising Hodor." "American Hodor Story." "How I Met Your Hodor." #AddHodorToATVTitle

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 13, 2012

I'm concerned that #BreakingBad is going to keep us from discussing Sunday's #TheNewsroom, which is a shame because oh my goodness.

— Scott Tobias (@scott_tobias) July 13, 2012

I've never looked forward to anything in any summer more than I'm looking forward to Sunday's Breaking Bad.

— Seth Meyers (@sethmeyers) July 13, 2012

I hope Breaking Bad comes full circle and the series ends with Jesse Pinkman becoming a science teacher.

— pilot (@pilotbacon) July 13, 2012

Dear everyone I love, I'd skip your funeral to watch Breaking Bad on Sunday.

— Morgan Murphy (@morgan_murphy) July 13, 2012

Man, Vince Gilligan's as lazy as Sorkin! RT @alisonwillmore: Supercut of Jesse Pinkman saying "yo." (via @vulture) http://t.co/t8tonVLX

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) July 13, 2012

Running off together! @brianstelter: Yesterday Steven Tyler, today J Lo says she's leaving "Idol:" http://t.co/6Pz01eNX (via @ryanseacrest)

— Ellen Gray (@elgray) July 13, 2012

Unintended consequence of J-Lo/Tyler departures: Lots of side-by-side photos that look like a cosmetic procedure's before-and-after ad.

— Tim Carvell (@timcarvell) July 13, 2012

#Idol now has worse continuity than #Glee. Major achievement!

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 13, 2012

Romney interviews are on network news tonight. Watch the big screen in the den on a low-numbered channel. Ask your parents for help.

— pourmecoffee (@pourmecoffee) July 13, 2012

I would, in an instant, create a dark AMC-style drama starring Janeane Garafalo.

— Muffin MacGuffinðŸ•¯ (@MuffMacGuff) July 13, 2012

The cast overlap between Rookie Blue and Saving Hope makes me think Canadian actors all sit in a big room waiting to be called for a part.

— June Thomas (@junethomas) July 13, 2012

Would Greta Van Susteren be more truthful if we briefly went Off the Record?

— Michael Markowitz (@markowitz) July 14, 2012

This 1990 episode of Law & Order is oddly judgmental, at least in comparison with later eps. Chris Noth had so many tartan ties.

— June Thomas (@junethomas) July 14, 2012

There is something poetic about Community's SDCC panel being on Friday the 13th.

— Andrew Seroff (@Aseroff) July 13, 2012

God, there's gonna be a huge pillow/blanket war between #Community & #Firefly fans if the former panel goes long, isn't there? #SDCC

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 13, 2012

No amount of live-tweeting can properly capture the humor, sincerity, love & genuine passion exploding out of this #Firefly reunion #SDCC

— Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) July 13, 2012

So Joss Whedon just offered everyone free puppies for life, right?That's why the cheering won't stop? #outsideofballroom20andthereischeering

— Marisa Roffman (@marisaroffman) July 13, 2012

Joss & cast in tears as joss tries to say what the fans mean to him. Entire audience goes to their feet. Then cast gives joss standing O too

— Loquaciousmuse (@loquaciousmuse) July 13, 2012

Just got to be part of a thousand person standing ovation that made Joss Whedon cry. So, yea, my #SDCC is already complete #Firefly

— Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) July 13, 2012

Going by the man-on-the-street tweets I'm seeing from SDCC, elevators must be the most terrifying place for celebrities to go.

— Ken! The Herald Angels Sing (@kenlowery) July 13, 2012

tweets.author_name: heather "if u spoil Last Jedi ur dead to me" mason
tweets.html:
Just rode the elevator with John Noble. I'm freaking out. #SDCC

— heather "if u spoil Last Jedi ur dead to me" mason (@NerdHeather) July 13, 2012

I'm not at Comicon, but I do have some cool DVDs at home. So I'm good.

— Scott Chernoff (@ScottChernoff) July 13, 2012

Oh God. I can't learn new #GOT names at this point. I'm calling all new character in S3 "Arnold." Even the women.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 13, 2012

"You're in Game of Thrones! And YOU'RE in Game of Thrones! EVERYONE'S IN GAME OF THRONES!" --Oprah as HBO casting director #GOT

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 13, 2012

Are you remotely a European actor and DIDN'T get cast in Game of Thrones just now? MCDONALD'S.

— Matt Mitovich (@MattMitovich) July 13, 2012

Joss Whedon solo panels are like Kevin Smith's chat-fests, only they're humble, understated and devoid of poop jokes.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 14, 2012

"Nobody is pure evil, except for a couple of guys, and nobody is pure good, except for me." Joss on moral ambiguity in drama.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) July 14, 2012

Dr. Horrible is going to air on TV: AWESOME! Dr. Horrible is going to air on The CW: ............???????????????

— Cameron White (@JediDusk) July 14, 2012

Okay, Marti Noxon has a child with her and not a terrifying, shrunken, smaller head resting on her shoulder, as I originally assumed. #sdcc

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 14, 2012

There should really be some sort of ComicCon-type event for people who are big fans of comic books.

— Tim Carvell (@timcarvell) July 14, 2012

And now I see the tweets coming in from #BreakingBad #SDCC and they are talking about the one true love of my life: Vince Gilligan.

— Linda H (@bookdal) July 14, 2012

Cranston has the entire audience sitting on his knee while he dispenses sage wisdom. This guy is THE BEST. #BreakingBad #SDCC

— Tim Surette (@timsurette) July 14, 2012

To whoever I watch Breaking Bad with: I will go Hank Schrader on anyone who wants to pause it to use the bathroom or make a call.

— Mindy Kaling (@mindykaling) July 14, 2012

It is time for the FlashForward Season Two panel. #whatyouvebeenwaitingfor #sdcc

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 14, 2012

So @KateComer just walked by me and didn't stop to say, "HELLO, TODD. ARE YOU EXCITED TO KNOW MORE ABOUT FLASHFORWARD, SEASON TWO?!" #sdcc

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 14, 2012

"Any time a showrunner says, 'We have a five year plan,' bullshit." Javier Grillo-Marxuach is entertaining. #sdcc

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 14, 2012

Wendy on Middleman's father was a Middleman who left to handle a conflict in another world. #sdcc

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 14, 2012

I wish @tvoti would start tweeting in English again. #SoConfused #LongWeek

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) July 14, 2012

We are now watching the ends of all of these shows TO REMIND OURSELVES OF WHAT HAS BEEN LOST. #sdcc

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 14, 2012

I AM NOT MAKING UP THIS PANEL, YOU GUYS. IT IS REALLY HAPPENING. #sdcc

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 14, 2012

Well, @tvoti's having his psychotic break on Twitter. Who had July in the poll?

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) July 14, 2012

Now we are watching the end of #FIREFLY. I just want to remind you that #FIREFLY was canceled. #sdcc

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 14, 2012

.@MittRomney r u having fun at comic-con?

— rob delaney (@robdelaney) July 14, 2012

Hoping someday to have a Men of a Certain Age reunion at Melancholic-Con

— Mike Royce (@MikeRoyce) July 14, 2012

You can't purchase tickets to Melancholic-Con, you can only miss the opportunity and then long for what might have been.

— Mike Royce (@MikeRoyce) July 14, 2012

The panel on canceled TV shows has been canceled. This is the only appropriate ending. #sdcc

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 14, 2012

If Extra has the audacity to put a white rapper on their stage at #SDCC, they should have the decency to have a soundproof bubble around it.

— MavisGaryVEVO (@MisterMcCracken) July 14, 2012

Breaking: Adam Scott ordering Mai-Tai at hotel bar, still hunky. #SDCC #tvsdcc

— price ðŸ”‡ (@pricepeterson) July 14, 2012

When people talk about the #SDCC parties they hit, I'm all, "What? You assholes don't have to write 2,000 words on the futility of it all?!"

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) July 14, 2012

1) Jesse; 2) Mike; 3) Marie; 4) Walt, but only insofar as I need to see something terrible befall him; 5) Hank; 6) Skyler; 7) Saul; 8) Jr.

— Joe Reid (@joereid) July 14, 2012

Not a bad show when your 8th favorite character is still a lovable nuisance rather than a problematic waste of screentime.

— Joe Reid (@joereid) July 14, 2012

52) Ted Beneke

— Joe Reid (@joereid) July 14, 2012

I wish Jack Nicholson had a podcast where he told a ton of scandalous old Hollywood stories after 3-4 glasses of wine.

— Brian Grubb (@briancgrubb) July 14, 2012

Unless they are doing a piece on a hospice program, People Magazine needs to take a forking break from using the phrase "The Final Days".

— Paula Pell (@perlapell) July 14, 2012

I miss turning on TV at 7pm every night and watching entertainers instead of shows about entertainers.

— Paula Pell (@perlapell) July 14, 2012

It's crazy to think that in just 10-15 years, Harrison Ford's earring will be hallucinating its own dancing Ally McBeal babies!

— Julie Klausner (@julieklausner) July 14, 2012

I can't sleep because I can't stop worrying about Jesse Pinkman.

— pilot (@pilotbacon) July 14, 2012

Hour-long shot of Janelle & Wil in hammock. J discusses making #2 while pregnant. Cut to Boogie & Hantz discussing dwarf tossing. only #bb14

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) July 14, 2012

I feel myself growing dumber w/every minute I watch the #bb14 live feeds. I'm the reality TV version of Charlie from Flowers for Algernon.

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) July 14, 2012

Another spambot-related disappointment: no bot that shouts "STEVE HOLT!" Twitter, why must you let me down again?

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) July 14, 2012

I will bet you a million dollars that sometimes, when it's late and he's naked, Peter Weller walks around his mansion like Robocop.

— kevinbiegel (@kbiegel) July 14, 2012

It's hard to care about Team Jake and Team Matty when Team Jenna's Dad is right there. #Awkward.
